data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The instructions say you always face forward when you are doing this. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can take four steps. Take four steps. Turn around. Turn around. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Before turning around, the first 8 steps were 6 * 6 = 108 steps. You must turn around after 10 steps. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
One steps in 4 steps to get to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person either takes 5 steps to return to starting point or takes it back down to starting point for their next exercise. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You turn around and turn around and turn right. You then turn left and turn right. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 8 steps and take 8 steps to go home. Take 9 steps and return to go to starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You turn around and then take 8 steps to get to your original starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If someone always faces forward they will not accidentally step onto the starting point. If one takes one step forward left a person begins the same process as the previous step, but after one steps backward it reverses itself. These two things mean that you cannot automatically return to the starting point. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Turning around entails taking a different sequence of steps from start to finish. In the first sequence, you take 2 steps to get back where you started. In the second sequence, you take 7 steps to get back where you started. One sequence gives you 4 steps but if you use the third sequence, you are given 3 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
For every step backward, a step is taken forward. To return to any step, you need to take one step forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you are facing forward, you always face forward. In order to get back to your starting point, you must take 2 steps right. If you were facing in the opposite direction that you started, you would not automatically go back. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

One can return to the starting point but cannot come back. If you take 1 step left, you go back and take 3 steps left. One can also take 3 steps backwards; one can take 1 step left, take 3 steps right and then take 4 steps right. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 5 steps forward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps right. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, we can say that you always face forward. In fact, from the beginning. If you always face behind, you are usually facing backward. If you always look forward, you should always look forward. In the beginning, you are always facing forward, so you have to always face forward. If you always turn your face to the left before starting, you will always turn your face to the right. To make an example, look in the opposite direction of where you started, and take 3 steps right. To make an example of the starting direction, look in the opposite direction of where you started, and take 3 steps right. Thus, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right (return). Turn right -> (return). Turn around (turning around). Turn left (turning left). Take 10 steps. Take eight steps. The instructions take 4 steps or 10 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 3 steps. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can make an obstacle into a starting point with one motion. If you take 10 steps, you take 10 steps to turn around. If you take 10 steps, you take 9 steps to turn around. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can turn around and return to your starting point by taking 9 steps. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 2 steps. Take 9 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn a corner. Turn around and take 2 steps, and back to the starting point. Turn around and take 9 steps, and back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To take 1 step and back and take 7 steps are the same. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 1 step. Take 1 step. Take 3 steps. Turn left. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 1 step and take 3 steps. Then you can return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 5 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 2 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around is an action that takes two steps. When people turn around, they take 10 steps. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
In the first sequence, you start from 3 steps at the beginning. In the second sequence, you start from 7 steps at the beginning. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The instructions are to always face forward. Whenever you start with 8 steps left, this is before moving left or right. Moving from left to right after facing forward is the same as moving from right to left. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 9 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
When you face forward, your feet should fall forward. If you face backwards, you should take 7 steps backwards. When you look left, you should take 9 steps left. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting point of a journey are all the places you start. The answer: Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps left. Take 6 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person facing forward needs to take 6 steps right and 6 steps left. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right. Take 5 steps. Turn around. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It is impossible to take 10 steps forward without taking back 3 steps. It takes 8 steps to go straight back 5 steps backwards. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 4 steps. Take 1 step. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Some of the steps are the same as taking 1 step. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
People doing the instructions will turn around if they take 11 steps. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 10 steps right. Take 7 steps backward. Take 3 steps left. Take 8 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward then the starting point is always facing forward. If you always take 7 steps backward then you take 7 steps backward. If you always take 3 steps left then the starting point would be taking 3 steps left. If you always take 8 steps backward then you take 8 step backward. If you always take 9 steps right then the starting point would be facing right. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn around and turn around are the same motion. So, if you have one step left, you would take 1 step and if you turn around and turn around, take 6 steps. Thus, the answer is No.

If you always face forward you will always land onward. If you take five steps backwards you will always land on your left side. This is because the backward step is your way back to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

You only return to the starting point if you follow steps 1 through 7 carefully. You can not take steps 5 - 7 or even 10 - 7. So, the answer is No.

An additional 5 steps tuesday for a return of 5 steps will provide for a return to 5 steps. Taking 7 steps tuesday for a return of 7 steps will provide for a return to 14 steps. Taking 10 steps tuesday for a return of 10 steps will provide for a return to 10. So, the answer is No.

There are at least 2 ways of facing forward and 2 ways of facing backward. The instructions say 7 steps left in the first instructions and 3 steps right at the ending. So, the answer is Yes.

After you take 6 steps forward, the next time you take 2 steps backward, you take 2 steps backward. If you always face forward, you won' t take 2 steps backward. So, the answer is no.

If you always face forward, the process is simple and straightforward. If you face backward, the process is reversed. So, the answer is No.

Every single time you take a step backward, you move another 4 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

The sequence of steps pointing you backwards is one way of telling you that you begin at your starting point. There are 3 sets of instructions. Thus, the answer is No.

Turning left goes inward, which will take 2 steps. Turning right goes left. So, the answer is No.

Take 5 steps left. This will return to the starting point. You can take 6 steps right, 9 steps right or 5 steps left to get to the starting point. Thus, the answer is No.

When a person always travels, one always wants to follow the forward path. The forward path is always facing forward. When a person always journeys, one always faces the left. So, the answer is no.

Either every step backward makes all the steps right or every step forward makes it right. The instructions are the exact same as if you were doing only step one. So, the answer is No.

For the same amount of steps on each side, it’s a total of 24 total steps. The starting point is facing forward once again. Thus, the answer is No.
